document.docAuthor: Fu, Yue, Hestenes, Tor Christian & Saether, Ole
document.masterDocTitle: Review of Afrotropical Thienemanniella Kieffer (Diptera: Chironomidae: Orthocladiinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Review of Afrotropical Thienemanniella Kieffer (Diptera: Chironomidae: Orthocladiinae)

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 1.
Thienemanniella antennata Freeman.
Adult male. A. Head. B. Antenna. C. Tentorium, stipes and cibarial pump. D. Thorax. E. Wing. F . Hind tibial apex. G. Hypopygium, dorsal view. H. Hypopygium, ventral view. I. Measurements of hind tibia.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined. SOUTH AFRICA : Cape Province, Wellington, Berg River, Piquetberg, paratype 1 3,
30.x. 1952
, K.M.F. Scott ( BMNH ); Cape Province, Berg River, Station 3, 1 3,
14.iv. 1953
, K.M.F. Scott ( BMNH ); Transvaal, Vaal River, Vereigenung, 5 3,
22. x. 1952
, K.M.F Scott, ( BMNH ); Transvaal, Lydenburg, 1 3,
14.ix. 1954
, A.D. Harrison ( BMNH ). Natal , Tugela River, Colenso,
1 3, 14
â€“ 30 .ix. 1953 , A.D. Harrison ( BMNH ); Natal , Great Usutu River, Amsterdam, 2 3,
19.ix. 1954
, A.D. Harrison ( BMNH ); Natal , Mooi River, Kambergs Game Reserve,
1 3, 14
â€“ 30 .ix. 1953 , A.D. Harrison ( BMNH ); GHANA : Volta Region, Lake Volta, Akosombo, Boat Harbour, 3 3,
9. x. 1992
, NUFU-project, T. Andersen, ( ZMBN ).

Diagnostic characters. The adult male can be separated from all other members of the genus, except
T. lobapodema
Hestenes et Saether (Hestenes & Saether 2000 )
by having inferior volsella as a digitiform median projection with a weak apodeme. It is distinguishable from
T. lobapodema
by having only one anal vein in the wing and no setae on tergite IX. The superior volsella is a broad, flat rim along the gonocoxite narrowly fused anteriorly. The first abdominal tergite carries 1 mediolateral seta to each side.

Adult male (n = 10â€“12 ). Total length 1.03â€“1.57 , 1.24 mm . Wing length 0.76â€“1.08 , 0.89 mm . Total length/ wing length 1.24â€“1.57 , 1.37 . Wing length/ length of profemur 3.39â€“4.26 , 3.73 . Wing width/wing length 0.38â€“ 0.39 ( 2 ).
Coloration . Head dark brown to black with yellow brown antenna; thorax black, scutum and vittae evenly colored; abdomen black with pale median area in tergite VI and VII, sternites paler.

Head (
Figs 1
Aâ€“C). Eyes hairy; height of eye/height of head 0.56â€“0.73 , 0.66 . Antennal ratio varies between localities; Lydenburg 0.88 ( 1 ), Vaal River and Tugela River 0.64â€“0.79 , 0.69 ( 6 ), Usutu River and Berg River 0.46â€“0.64 , 0.55 ( 4 ), Lake Volta 0.65â€“0.68 ( 3 ). Antenna (
Fig. 1
B) with 10 flagellomeres; flagellum apically club-shaped, flat and notched; with apical several sensilla chaetica and 26 â€“45, 33 basal setae; 186â€“ 247, 213 ( 8 ) Âµm long. Tentorium, stipes and cibarial pump as in
Fig. 1
C; tentorium 104â€“129, 116 Âµm long, stipes 68 â€“95, 79 Âµm long. Length of palpomeres (in Âµm): 11 â€“18, 14; 13 â€“18, 15; 22 â€“35, 26; 33 â€“47, 40, 80â€“ 117, 102 . Palpomere 5 / 3 ratio: 3.0â€“ 4.3 , 3.5 ; palpomere 3 rounded rectangular to round. Clypeus with 6 â€“11, 8 setae. Palpomere 3 apparently lacking sensilla clavata. No outer verticals, coronals 4 .

Thorax (
Fig. 1
D). Anapleural suture 77â€“143, 108 Âµm long. Antepronotals absent, dorsocentrals 7 â€“11, 9 uniserial, prealars 1 â€“3, 2, scutellars 1 â€“2, 1.

Wing (
Fig. 1
E). VR 1.68â€“1.88 , 1.77 ( 6 ). Only one anal vein present; An 1 /wing length 0.44â€“0.48 , 0.47 ( 6 ); PCu/wing length 0.54â€“0.69 , 0.58 ( 6 ); C 278â€“463, 352 ( 6 ) Âµm long; Cu 384â€“491, 416 ( 6 ) long. Brachiolum with 1 seta; costa with 11 â€“16, 13 uniserial setae, wing setation otherwise as for
T. trivittata
.

Legs. Fore trochanter with dorsal keel. Spur of fore tibia 18 â€“27, 23 ( 4 ) Âµm long, serrated with additional 2 thin setae 16 ( 1 ) Âµm long apically. Spurs of mid tibia 9â€“12 ( 3 ) Âµm land 10 ( 2 ) Âµm long, and of hind tibia (
Fig. 1
F) 12 â€“23, 17 Âµm and 9 ( 3 ) Âµm long, and slightly inwards curved seta 16â€“20 ( 3 ) Âµm long. Apex of fore tibia 15 â€“27, 23 Âµm, of mid tibia 18 â€“27, 23 Âµm, of hind tibia (a) 25 â€“34, 39 Âµm wide. Width of hind tibia 1 / 3 from apex (d) 16 â€“24, 20 Âµm, elongation (b) 11 â€“18, 14 Âµm long, maximum thickening at (c 1 ) 23 â€“45, 32 Âµm from apex; total length of thickening (c 2 ) 34 â€“73, 52 Âµm; a/d 1.08â€“1.88 , 1.46 ; b/d 0.55â€“0.94 , 0.72 ; c 1 /d 1.05â€“1.22 , 1.64 ; c 2 /d 1.88â€“3.84 , 2.42 . Hind tibial comb with 11 â€“13, 12 setae. Sensilla chaetica on legs apparently lacking. Ta 1 of p 2 with 5â€“7 strong setae, ta 1 of p 3 with two ventral rows of
6â€“8 and 8â€“10
strong setae. Tarsomere 4 of all legs weakly cordiform. Lengths (in Âµm) and proportions of legs as in
Table 2
.

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 2. Lengths (in Âµm) and proportions of legs segments of male of
T. antennata Freeman.

subSubSection.paragraph: fe ti ta 1 ta 2 ta 3 ta 4

Hypopygium (
Fig. 1
Gâ€“H). Sternite VIII bare, tergite IX with 4â€“6 short setae, laterosternites IX with 1 seta. Superior volsella anteriomedially narrowly fused, posteriorly as a broad pale rim on gonocoxite. Inferior volsella digitiform, bare, with weak internal apodeme. Phallapodeme straight 29 â€“38, 34 Âµm long. Transverse sternapodeme 23 â€“35, 27 Âµm, lateral sternapodeme 25 â€“43, 27 Âµm long. Gonostylus megaseta stout, 6â€“7 Âµm long. Thin glandular setae on inner margin of gonocoxite. HR 2.46â€“3.50 , 3.05 ( 8 ), HV 3.91â€“5.33 , 4.86 ( 6 )
Distribution. The species is known from Cape Province, Natal and Transvaal in South Africa and from the Lake Volta Area in Ghana .
